body_html:
Then TensorFlow is unable to find your CUDA install, most likely. Try adding

export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/usr/local/cuda/lib64:/usr/local/cuda/lib"

to ~/.bashrc and open a new terminal and try python -c 'import tensorflow' and see if it finds CUDA.

I'm assuming you're using Ubuntu or Debian, and that you've installed CUDA at its default location.

Semi-related: #2626

body:
Then TensorFlow is unable to find your CUDA install, most likely. Try adding
```
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/usr/local/cuda/lib64:/usr/local/cuda/lib"
```
to ~/.bashrc and open a new terminal and try `python -c 'import tensorflow'` and see if it finds CUDA.

I'm assuming you're using Ubuntu or Debian, and that you've installed CUDA at its default location.

Semi-related: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/2626
